properties.name: Laurelwood Public House
properties.description: Posted by Garlynn 1728 ne 40th ave, portland, orA great little certified-organic brewpub in the Hollywood district of NE Portland. You can see their shiny basement brewery from the pub, and it certainly looks like an impressive operation!! Makes you want to quaff one of their fine beers and have some of their tasty food to go along with it.

properties.name: Moon and Sixpence British Pub
properties.description: Posted by Birdonfly 2014 NE 42nd Ave 97213Lots of bench tables and plenty of space. The patio is enclosed, so there is not good city-watching, but it\'s a good place. A little hard to find and not well-lit. On a warm evening, the inside of the bar will be empty and the patio kickin\'. Can you say, "Guinness"?

properties.name: Nature Bake
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse 1170 NE 63rd Ave, Portland, OR 97213Great local bakery - home of Dave\'s Killer Blues Bread and the BEST ginger meltaways you\'ll ever eat. Get the day-olds. They are worth every penny.

properties.name: Pix Patisserie
properties.description: Posted by Rupi 3402 SE Division, Portland, ORMy favorite place in PDX to get dessert. They are beautiful and yummy. Great wine and beer list, cosy environment and friendly staff.

properties.name: The Daily Market and Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Pumemij     5250 NE Halsey St, Portland, Oregon, 97213I like having coffee here. They also have good breakfast, and it\'s close to the dog park. Yay!
